results.title: Images for quartet
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Otton and Robert Parker
results.brief_description: Looks at the professional and private lives of the four musicians in the Carl Pini String Quartet (Carl Pini, violin; Gordon Bennet, violin; John Godd, viola; Barbara Woolley, cello) to the music of Debussy and Mendelssohn, and Australian composers Richard Meale and Brian Buggy. Note: A short version of the film ‘String quartet’ made in 1972.

results.title: Images de France. Part 2
results.brief_description: Everyday french..easy…entertaining…effective. This unique video learning technique was evolved by Dr Dickinson, PhD, extensively researched at the University Of London and produced at the Manchester University Television Centre. The course consists of two videos ( each with its own “Viewers Guide” booklet), containing 17 programs. You’ll be involved in amusing conversations and funny dramatic and romantic episodes. In next to no time it seems, you find that you will have absorbed the “feel” of France and can converse fluently in French.

results.title: Images and meaning
results.creator_credit: Video Education Australasia and Alan Woodruff
results.brief_description: The central objective of this program is to encourage students to develop their analytical skills in visual literacy. The program looks at how to analyse the non-print text of newspaper images. Using “The Age” as a case study it examines the production of photography, cartoons and graphic design, the process of choice and editorial decision making, how to critically analyse the meaning of these images and what shapes that meaning. It also informs students about the way media images are generated and deepens theit appreciation of the selective way the world is represented through newspapers. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary students.

results.title: Image makers (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Institute of Early Childhood Studies (Waverley, N.S.W.) and Ursula Kolbe
results.brief_description:
Looks at the way children make images and how this helps them explore and cope with the world at large, giving it order and meaning.

Includes footage from the Murawina Aboriginal Education Centre in Redfern, Sydney.

results.title: Illuminations
results.creator_credit: Australia Council, Tibor Markus and Paul Cox
results.brief_description: A young couple live in an almost hallucinatory world. Through the death of the girl’s father a sense of the infinite develops between them. Their love gives both of them enough self knowledge to become highly alert and sensitive. They become free and detached from the normal anxieties, pressures fears and hopes of society. “Illuminations” makes an attempt at extending consciousness beyond the limits imposed by our ego. Man always underestimates the power of the mind and confuses it with his own man-made illusions. Cast: Gabriella Trsek, Anthony Llewellyn Jones Norman Kaye, Sheila Florence, Athol Smith, Tibor Markus.

results.title: Illuminated lives
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Margaret Pettigrew and Ellen Besen
results.brief_description: This vivid animation re-creates scenes of women at work in the meadows, markets and castles of yesteryear. It lifts women’s lives out of the anonymity of the Middle Ages and shows that then, as now, women of all classes performed a variety of tasks and played a dynamic role in society. The film was inspired by actual medieval illuminations, the painted pictures and ornate letters and designs used to decorate handwritten books of the period. It reflects the vibrant colour and naive style of perspective typical of such medieval art. The music, also inspired by the era, is performed on authentic period instruments.

results.title: Illegal abortion
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover and Robin Spry
results.brief_description: A dramatization that illustrates the situation of a young couple, particularly of the young woman, faced with an unwanted pregnancy and desiring an abortion forbidden by law. The film portrays her dilemma from the time the pregnancy is confirmed by her doctor to the harrowing moments in a back room where it is terminated by an illegal practitioner. Photographed by Robert Nichol. Edited by Roy Ayton Sound by Victor Merrill. Cast includes: Sabina Fircks, Frank Heron, Elaine Ives Cameron, Ken James, Bill Lynn, Walter Massey, Vladimir Rajewsky, David Schurmann

results.title: Il Trovatore by Giuseppe Verdi
results.creator_credit: Australian Opera, Brian Adams and Riccardo Pellizzeri
results.brief_description: Sung in Italian and with English sub-titles, this performance was recorded live at the Sydney Opera House, July 2, 1983 and is part of the popular ‘Esso night at the opera’. Performers include: Cynthia Johnston, Joan Sutherland, Jonathan Summers, Kenneth Collins. The Australian Opera (Sydney) conducted by Richard Bonynge. Staged by Elijah Moshinsky. Features the Australian Opera Chorus and Elizabethan Sydney Orchestra.
